page.title: 05KNOWLTON - HENGE MONUMENT
page.content: Knowlton Church & Knowlton Rings are owned by Lord Shaftesbury whose ancestors bought them from the Sturt family in l79l. Knowlton is a {pre-historic site}with ramparts of a Neolithic henge encircling the walls of a deserted Norman Church remodelled in the l4th Century. Today the grassy ramparts are a{popular picnic site &}a {tourist attraction.}In Spring the slopes are covered with yellow cowslips & now the Department of the Environment who tend the site very wisely refrain from cutting the grass until after the flowers have seeded. Other{chalk-soil flora}also abound including orchids, bellflowers & quaking grass. All the surrounding {land is farmed by the Shaftesbury} {Estate}which has a herd of Friesian cows as well as growing cereals.
